com.smartnsoft.droid4me.download

Class DownloadInstructions.AbstractInstructions

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.smartnsoft.droid4me.download.DownloadInstructions.Instructions
      • com.smartnsoft.droid4me.download.DownloadInstructions.SimpleInstructions
        • com.smartnsoft.droid4me.download.DownloadInstructions.AbstractInstructions
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BasisDownloadInstructions.Instructions<DownloadInstructions.BitmapableBitmap,DownloadInstructions.ViewableView>
    Enclosing class:
    DownloadInstructions

    public static class DownloadInstructions.AbstractInstructions
extends DownloadInstructions.SimpleInstructions
    An implementation of the DownloadInstructions.Instructions, which returns the bitmapUid as an URL, and which does not present any temporary nor local bitmap.

    Caution: this implementation supposes that the provided is actually an in the onBindBitmap(boolean, View, Bitmap, String, Object) method.

      • computeUrl

        public java.lang.String computeUrl(java.lang.String bitmapUid,
                          java.lang.Object imageSpecs)
        Description copied from interface: BasisDownloadInstructions.Instructions
        Given the bitmap identifier, its extra specifications, returns its URL, which will be used for downloading it.

        This method will be invoked from the GUI thread, if and only if the CoreBitmapDownloader#get(boolean, boolean, Viewable, String, Object, com.smartnsoft.droid4me.download.DownloadContracts.Handlerable, Instructions) method has been invoked with a isPreBlocking argument set to true. However, it is ensured that this method will be only be invoked at most once per CoreBitmapDownloader#get(boolean, boolean, Viewable, String, Object, com.smartnsoft.droid4me.download.DownloadContracts.Handlerable, Instructions) method invocation (i.e. for a command).

        For performance reasons, the method does not manage RuntimeException: this is the reason why the implementation should make sure that no such error occurs ; in particular, pay attention to the NullPointerException

        Returns:
        the URL that will be used to investigate on whether the bitmap is already in cache memory, persisted, and to download it from the network. If the method returns null, it will be considered that no bitmap is available for the imageUid

      • downloadInputStream

        public java.io.InputStream downloadInputStream(java.lang.String bitmapUid,
                                      java.lang.Object imageSpecs,
                                      java.lang.String url)
                                        throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: BasisDownloadInstructions.Instructions
        Should download from the network the input stream corresponding to the bitmap.

        The callback is invoked when the #getInputStream(String, Object, String, InputStreamDownloadInstructor) method could not return a valid input stream. This callback will not be invoked if the CoreBitmapDownloader.isConnected() returns false.

        Returns:
        the input stream corresponding to the bitmap ; the returned should not be null in case of failure, but the method should throw a IOException exception instead
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a network problem occurred while downloading the bitmap
        See Also:
        BasisDownloadInstructions.Instructions.onInputStreamDownloaded(String, Object, String, InputStream)

      • convert

        public DownloadInstructions.BitmapableBitmap convert(java.io.InputStream inputStream,
                                            java.lang.String bitmapUid,
                                            java.lang.Object imageSpecs,
                                            java.lang.String url)
        Is responsible for turning the provided input stream into a bitmap representation.

        The method measures the time taken for the conversion, and logs that duration. The technical part of the method is delegated to the convertInputStreamToBitmap(InputStream, String, Object, String) method.

        Parameters:
        inputStream - the implementation should not close the input stream, because the caller will InputStream.close() it (no problem if it is closed, but this will impact the performance)
        Returns:
        by default, the returned wrapped Bitmap will have the device density
        See Also:
        convert(InputStream, String, Object, String)

      • onOver

        public void onOver(boolean aborted,
          DownloadInstructions.ViewableView view,
          java.lang.String bitmapUid,
          java.lang.Object imageSpecs)
        Description copied from interface: BasisDownloadInstructions.Instructions
        This method is invoked systematically once the command is over, either when it has successfully completed, or when it has been aborted.

        Do not make any assumption regarding the thread invoking that method: it may be the GUI thread or a background taken from a worker thread!

        This callback is especially useful the unitary tests.

        Parameters:
        aborted - true when and only when the command has been aborted, because another command working on the same view has also been stacked in the meantime

      • convertInputStreamToBitmap

        protected android.graphics.Bitmap convertInputStreamToBitmap(java.io.InputStream inputStream,
                                                 java.lang.String bitmapUid,
                                                 java.lang.Object imageSpecs,
                                                 java.lang.String url)
        Actually converts the given InputStream into an Android Bitmap.

        The hereby implementation does not perform any scaling.

        Parameters:
        inputStream - the representation of the Bitmap to be decoded
        Returns:
        the decoded Bitmap if the conversion could be performed properly ; null otherwise
        See Also:
        convert(InputStream, String, Object, String)
